results.title: Pan seared salmon in spiced coconut milk

steps.step: In a bowl whisk together the first 7 ingredients and set aside.
Add olive oil to an iron skillet over medium heat.
Sprinkle the salmon with salt and place skin side up. Sear for 1 minute and then flip the fillets over.
Pour in the cream and add the carrots; let the mixture and salmon cook for 7-8 minutes or until salmon is done.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

ingredients.aisle: Canned and Jarred;Milk, Eggs, Other Dairy
ingredients.name: coconut milk
salt
ingredients.original: 1/4 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning
ingredients.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning

ingredients.aisle: Canned and Jarred;Milk, Eggs, Other Dairy
ingredients.name: coconut milk

ingredients.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning

ingredients.name: coconut milk

steps.step: In a large bowl combine yogurt, olive oil, garlic, turmeric, cayenne pepper (if using), garam masala, salt, cumin, lime and lime zest.
Place chicken in marinade and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 8 hours or overnight.
Remove the chicken from the marinade. Reserve marinade.In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until it browns slightly. About 4 minutes each side.
Add onions and cook 2 minutes.

Pour coconut milk and marinade over the top, stir. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 30-35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.Stir in cilantro just before serving.
Serve.

ingredients.name: fresh cilantro
ingredients.original: 1 teaspoon dried cilantro or 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro
ingredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon dried cilantro or 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro
ingredients.originalName: dried cilantro or 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro

ingredients.name: juice of lime
ingredients.original: juice and zest of 1 lime (to get the zest of the lime, use a zester or the smallest holes on a cheese grater to shave the outer skin of the lime)
ingredients.originalString: juice and zest of 1 lime (to get the zest of the lime, use a zester or the smallest holes on a cheese grater to shave the outer skin of the lime)

steps.step: Bring a pot of water to boil.
Add in the cauliflower and boil for 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and set aside.
In a small bowl combine cardamom, cinnamon, turmeric, and salt.
Add the lamb to the bowl and thoroughly coat all sides with the seasoning.
Add olive oil to a saute pan over medium heat.
Add in the lamb mixture and cook for 5 minutes allowing it to brown. Then stir in cauliflower and peas; cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Season with salt before serving.

ingredients.name: extra-virgin olive oil
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons Organic Pompeian Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons Organic Pompeian Extra Virgin Olive Oil
ingredients.originalName: Organic Pompeian Extra Virgin Olive Oil

steps.step: Soak six 12-inch bamboo skewers in warm water for 30 minutes. Thread the chicken onto the skewers and set in a shallow glass baking dish.On a cutting board, use the side of a large knife to mash the garlic, ginger and salt to a paste. In a bowl, whisk the paste with the yogurt, mustard oil, lemon juice, cumin, mace, nutmeg, cardamom, turmeric, cayenne and black pepper.

Pour the marinade over the chicken; turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours, turning occasionally.Raita: On a cutting board, use the side of a large knife to mash the garlic with a large pinch of salt to a paste. In a medium bowl, mix the garlic paste with the yogurt, sour cream, cucumber, tomato, mint and toasted cumin. Season with salt and pepper and put in refrigerator.Light a grill. Lightly oil the grate. Grill the chicken over a medium-hot fire for about 4 minutes per side, or until it is cooked through and golden.
Serve with the lemon wedges, red onion, cilantro and Cucumber Raita.

ingredients.original: 1 medium cucumber (peeled, halved, seeded and chopped)

ingredients.original: 1⁄2 teaspoon cumin seed, lightly toasted and chopped
ingredients.originalString: 1⁄2 teaspoon cumin seed, lightly toasted and chopped

results.title: Salmon with Citrus Charred Scallions and Smashed Cucumber Salad

steps.step: Heat oven to 325F. Thinly slice four of the scallions and place them in a bowl. Set aside.
Place the salmon on a large baking dish skin-side down.
Drizzle with 2 tbsp olive oil and season to taste with salt and black pepper. Roast until medium-rare, about 10-12 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp of the remaining olive oil in a medium cast-iron skillet over medium high heat.
Add in the remaining scallions and cook until charred, about 4-6 minutes, tossing occasionally. Season to taste with salt and black pepper.
Transfer the charred scallions to a cutting board and coarsely chop them.
Add them to the bowl with the raw scallions along with the soy sauce, lemon juice, orange juice, and remaining ¼ cup olive oil. Season to taste with salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes.
Transfer the cooked salmon to a large serving platter, making sure to leave any skin in the baking pan. Top with spoonfuls of the charred scallion sauce and serve warm.
Heat the oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic to the pan and saute until toasted, about 2-3 minutes, swirling the pan occasionally.
Add in the turmeric and flaky salt. Stir to combine and remove from the heat. Set aside.

Add the cucumbers and a pinch of salt to a large resealable ziploc bag. Smash the cucumbers using a heavy pot or rolling pin until they start to split. Allow to rest for a few minutes so that the salt can draw out some of their liquid.
Drain the cucumbers and toss with the scallions and vinegar in a large serving bowl. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and more vinegar. Toss with the garlic oil and serve.

ingredients.name: salt and pepper
ingredients.original: salt and black pepper, to taste
ingredients.originalString: salt and black pepper, to taste
ingredients.originalName: salt and black pepper, to taste

ingredients.name: sea-salt
ingredients.original: 1 tsp flaky sea salt, plus more to taste
ingredients.originalString: 1 tsp flaky sea salt, plus more to taste
ingredients.originalName: flaky sea salt, plus more to taste

ingredients.name: black pepper
ingredients.original: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
ingredients.originalString: freshly ground black pepper, to taste
ingredients.originalName: freshly ground black pepper, to taste

steps.step: Make the seasoning by combining all of the seasoning ingredients in a small bowl or jar and mixing well.
Cut chicken into cubes and toss with the seasoning to cover the chicken cubes.
Rice cauliflower and chop the onion, pepper and cilantro. Set aside.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp ghee. Once the skillet is hot, add the chicken pieces, onion and poblano pepper to cook. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is fully cooked, about 8-10 minutes.
Add the cauliflower rice, lemon juice, salt and pepper to the pan with the chicken.
Mix everything together and cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice just starts to soften, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove from heat and serve chicken and cauliflower rice topped with chopped cilantro.

ingredients.name: chicken breast
ingredients.original: 1.5 lbs chicken breast, cut into cubes
ingredients.originalString: 1.5 lbs chicken breast, cut into cubes

ingredients.name: poblano pepper
ingredients.original: 1 poblano pepper, diced (or sub bell pepper)
ingredients.originalString: 1 poblano pepper, diced (or sub bell pepper)
ingredients.originalName: poblano pepper, diced (or sub bell pepper)

steps.step: Cut the chicken so that the legs are separated from the thighs, cut each breast in two lengthwise.
Mix together in a bowl the turmeric, fennel, coriander and chili powder with 3 tbsp water to make a paste.

Heat the oil over medium heat and fry the onions, ginger and garlic, till the onions are brown, 5 minutes.Turn the heat to low and fry the spice paste stir and cook for 5 minutes To the bowl in which the spices were mixed add 3 tbsp water, stir to remove all traces of the spices and add the water to the pan. Stir and cook 3 minutes.Turn the heat to medium and add the chicken, stir and fry for 4 minutes, till the chicken changes colour.

Add 1 tsp of the salt and the water, bring to the boil, cover with a lid, reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes.Melt the butter in a separate pan and add the garlic, curry leaves, cumin, fennel and red chillies. Stir and add the spinach and 1/2 tsp salt. Fry for 5 minutes.
Add the spinach to the chicken mix well, cover the pan and cook for 20 minutes.
Mix in the yogurt and garam masala stir well to blend the yogurt with the chicken and spinach . Cook uncovered 6 minutes, stirring frequently.

ingredients.name: spinach
ingredients.original: 1 lb fresh spinach or 8 ounces frozen chopped spinach
ingredients.originalString: 1 lb fresh spinach or 8 ounces frozen chopped spinach
ingredients.originalName: fresh spinach or 8 ounces frozen chopped spinach

ingredients.original: 1 lb fresh spinach or 8 ounces frozen chopped spinach
